RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACE'S SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AVE'S IN COMMAND away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, shook clear of his pace rival leaving the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive while holding off a late charge by WISE MARKET. WISE MARKET away well and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive while gaining ground late. CALAMAZEUS tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. VALUABLE COWBOY broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of AVE'S IN COMMAND entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and faded in the late going. MORETHANSOULTITLE settled at the back of a compact field while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, steadied when put in tight quarters leaving the turn, and lost all momentum. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of MORETHANSOULTITLE lodged a claim of foul again the rider's of both CALAMAZEUS and WISE MARKET for alleged interference entering the stretch. After review the claims of foul were disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, checked 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PETERSON LANDING away well and pressed the pace from the outside of MS. STANFORD entering the backstretch, took control entering the final turn, and was never threatened late under confident handling. ANZAC BAY broke sharply and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. ELLAMEISTER settled at the back of a compact field while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to garner a share. MS. STANFORD away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. PRINCESS HANNA tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, dropped back to trail entering the final turn, and had little to offer over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Hanna
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Ellameister
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anzac Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Peterson Landing
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Stanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000, For Each $2,500 To $45,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $62,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VIVA LA DIVA broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of ACOUSTIC MELODY in the run down the backstretch, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and held on while finishing along the rail. ACOUSTIC MELODY away alertly and tracked the leader through the first turn while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, struggled to match strides with her pace rival leaving the turn, and finished three wide to hold the place. BROOKE MAGIC away well and stalked the battling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished gamely from along the inside in the drive without clear sailing. HORATIO stalked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact while finishing four wide in the drive. DAZ LIN FORCE was off a step slow, but raced into a stalking trip two wide in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid when called upon. NU SOUP FOR BABY unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn, was always well back, and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Brooke Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied rail, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Daz Lin Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Acoustic Melody
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: Horatio
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Nu Soup for Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming P rice $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: C C SUNRISE away alertly and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed four wide in deep stretch to get up in time. DRILL BABY DRILL away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly while drifting off the rail in deep stretch to get up for the place. PENALTY TO RANGERS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, but faded in deep stretch while holding on for a share. TEXAS LEGACY settled off the early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied four wide entering he final turn, and finished five wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. PERFECT PENNY saved ground through the first turn and raced into a stalking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. AUNTIE J settled off the early pace while racing three out from the rail, trailed the field into the final turn, and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Penalty to Rangers
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2w, rallied 2 w, closed 4w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Auntie J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, trailed, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 30 Allow ed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOBESUNNY broke sharply and dueled the lead through the stretch the first time from the outside of STAR FINALITY, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to prove best. STAR FINALITY away alertly and raced to the lead in the run to the first turn while saving ground at the rail, battled through the turn from the inside of TOBESUNNY, continued to set a pressured pace from the inside of that rival through the second turn and in the run down the backside, the battled between the pacesetter continued through the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off a stubborn TOBESUNNY in deep stretch, while proving easily second best. SILVER ARROW settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, launched her bid smartly two wide entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. ISLAND LIVING away well and tracked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. PEACEHAVEN settled at the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the stretch the first time, continued with a wide trip throughout, and was unable to mount a serious late bid, while only passing a tiring rival late. STRIKING VALUE stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position into the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Peacehaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, wide trip, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, led, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3w, rallied 3w, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NOT WON $27,500 SINCE APRIL 30 . For Non Winners of a Stake since April 30, 2023. Weight, 122 lbs.; , 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 30 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPACE away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of BRIAN's DE LEIGHT entering the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of his pace rival leaving the turn, and finished determinedly from along the rail and held off a late surge by COUNTERACT to prevail. COUNTERACT stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, began to advance at the rail midway down the backstretch, saved ground while mounting his bid through the final turn, tipped three wide entering the lane to collar the leader, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to just miss. PURSUE was off a step slow, and trailed the field into the stretch the first time while saving ground along the inside, continued to bide his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid four wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing three wide in the drive to garner a share. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, struggled to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, steadied when in tight at the rail leaving the turn, and faded in the stretch drive. NEIGHBOR broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch, began to struggle to keep up in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of BRIAN's DE LEIGHT lodged a claim of foul against the rider of SPACE for alleged interference at the head of the lane. after review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, checked 1/8, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Space
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed rail, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Counteract
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Neighbor
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Pursue
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 30 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 30 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEIGHNEIGH settled well off the early pacesetter while saving ground along the inside entering the backstretch, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, steadied while running up on heels midway through the turn, shifted three wide leaving the turn, and closed with a rush four wide in the drive to get up in the closing strides. ADDENDUM settled off the early pace while saving ground entering the backstretch, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive while taking the narrowest of advantages in deep stretch, but was unable to fend off the late surge by NEIGHNEIGH in the final strides. BELCARRA PARK rushed to a clear lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, maintained a clear advantage into the final turn, and just failed to last, while proving clearly best of the rest. QUALITY COMMAND away well and was allowed to settle off the early leader while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, was pushed four wide leaving the turn, and finished evenly in the drive. HOAX away alertly and stalked the pacesetter into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. KAPALUA CANDY broke sharply and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. EBONY EYES was bumped solidly at the start, and trailed the field into the first turn, was always well back and never a factor. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of QUALITY COMMAND lodged a claim of foul against the rider of NEIGHNEIGH, for alleged interference leaving the final turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Hoax
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Addendum
ENTRY.OWNER: Freedom Farms Ltd Tom Peter and More Rewards Syndicate
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Quality Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Kapalua Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Ebony Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, trailed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Neighneigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Belcarra Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, outfinished late
